intro: Silphium elatum, commonly known as the giant silphium, is a tall, flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant can grow up to 10 feet in height and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Silphium elatum is known for its medicinal properties and was historically used by Native American tribes.
